SEARCH
Package org.lujza.quiz.util

Class PointsCounter

java.lang.Object
org.lujza.quiz.util.PointsCounter
public class PointsCounter extends Object
The PointsCounter class manages the scoring system for the quiz application. It keeps track of the user's total points, calculates points for correct and partially correct answers, and determines the user's grade based on the total points earned in relation to the maximum possible points.

  • Field Details

    • points

      private int points
      The current total of points accumulated by the user. This field tracks the user's score throughout the quiz, increasing as the user provides correct answers to questions. Points may be awarded based on the correctness of the answers, with possible adjustments for partial correctness or penalties.

  • Constructor Details

    • PointsCounter

      public PointsCounter()

  • Method Details

    • getPoints

      public int getPoints()
      Returns the total points earned by the user so far.
      Returns:
      the total points as an integer.

    • addPoints

      public void addPoints(Question question)
      Adds points for a correctly answered question to the user's total points. The number of points added is determined by the maximum points that can be gained for one question based on a specific theme.
      Parameters:
      question - the Question that was answered correctly.

    • addPartialPoints

      public void addPartialPoints(Set<String> set1, Set<String> set2, Question question)
      Adds partial points for a multiple choice question that was answered partially correct. The calculation considers the number of correct options chosen and the number of incorrect options chosen. Partial points are awarded if the number of mistakes made is exactly one.
      Parameters:
      set1 - a Set of strings representing the correct answers.
      set2 - a Set of strings representing the user's answers.
      question - the Question being evaluated.

    • printGrade

      public void printGrade(Theme theme)
      Prints the user's grade based on the points earned in relation to the total possible points for the chosen theme. The grade is determined by the percentage of points earned: 90% and above yields grade 1, 75% to 89% yields grade 2, 50% to 74% yields grade 3, and below 50% yields grade 4.
      Parameters:
      theme - the Theme for which the grade is being calculated.
